MFQP is working again. The library site for previous year papers has been down for most of this exam session, and since MFQP linked to the papers from there, the papers were not accessible. We have found a work-around now, and we are serving the papers from another file server.

You can prepare productively with access to QPs again. (Note that this is an archive of papers from 2014, so papers from 2015 won't be available)

http://qp.metakgp.org /

किसी भी देश के उत्थान में उस देश की भाषा की अत्यन्त महत्त्वपूर्ण भूमिका होती है। भारतीय संविधान ने 14 सितम्बर 1949 को हिंदी को भारत की राजभाषा घोषित किया था। 14 सितम्बर को हिंदी दिवस के अवसर पर राजभाषा विभाग, आईआईटी खड़गपुर हिंदी भाषा के प्रचार प्रसार के लिए विभिन्न कार्यक्रमों का आयोजन कर रहा है जिसमें सभी छात्र सादर आमंत्रित हैं।
दिनाँक - 14 सितम्बर
समय - 11 am - अतिथि व्याख्यान - श्री राहुल देव
5 pm - संवाद - श्री राहुल देव
स्थान - प्रो. एस एन बोस प्रेक्षागृह
अनुरोध है कि  इसे अपने सभी ग्रुपों में पोस्ट करें। राजभाषा हिंदी के प्रचार प्रसार में सहयोगी बनिए।  इन कार्यक्रमों में सभी भारतीय भाषा प्रेमियों का स्वागत है।

story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur updated their cover photo.

message:
Important Notice.
All the Exams of 13th September, 2016 have been shifted to 22nd September, 2016 due to Bakr Eid/Eid-ul-Adha festival. (Monday, Sept 12, SHALL NOT BE A HOLIDAY).
It is advised to confirm the dates for departmental exams with respective Professors and Exam Co-ordinator.

As per the memorandum released by the Ministry of Personnel, Public Grievances & Pensions, Department of Personnel & Training, Govt. of India and the circular sent therewith, Eid-al-Adha shall be observed throughout the country on 13th instead of 12th of September. The decision from the Central Government comes after the Imarat Shariah did not sight the new moon on Sep 2 that would herald the beginning of the month of Dhu al-Hijjah the next day. This resulted in the lunar month beginning on Sep 4, and since Eid-al-Adha is celebrated on the 10th day of this month, the festival of sacrifice for Muslims will fall on Sept 13 in India.

Please note that all the classes and official activities shall thereof remain administratively suspended on 13th instead of the earlier notification of September 12.
Apple has unveiled its long-awaited iPhone 7, featuring waterproofing, a dual-lens camera, no headphone jack and wireless AirPod headphones.

The Scholars' Avenue shared Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur's post.

An RTI filed to the MHRD has revealed that the annual electric bill paid by IIT Kharagpur to the Ministry of Energy & Power Distribution, Govt. of West Bengal, has surged steeply from Rupees 16 crores 18 lakhs in 2011 to an almost double of 31 crores 46 lakhs in 2016. Despite the introduction of several savings and alternative measures like replacement of traditional halogen street lamps with LED, sensor operated lights and installation of solar panels, this sharp upswing whereas can be attributed to an increase in research facilities and functioning of four new halls viz. RLB, LBS, BRH & NVH; it cannot be ruled out completely that the misuse and wastage do not have a colossal rise. The hall and department wise data obtained from the Electric Office unveils that the consumption has increased drastically in almost every hall and department.
Many a times we are seen to leave the lights and fans running while we go to the class; not because of our unwillingness but because of our carelessness. We should always remember that there are still 19,706 villages in our India (Data as of 2015, Census Board, Ministry of Home Affairs, Govt. of India) which remain un-electrified even after 69 years of our independence. Around 12% of our population do not know how does it feel to spend nights with lights!

We, from Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur urge each one of us to please use the electricity and water judiciously and encourage our friends towards the same. After all, every small contribution counts!

समर शेष है, नहीं पाप का भागी केवल व्याध,
जो तटस्थ हैं समय लिखेगा उनका भी अपराध। - राष्ट्रकवि डॉ श्री रामधारी सिंह 'दिनकर'

RLB, LBS, BRH & NVH; it cannot be ruled out completely that the misuse and wastage do not have a colossal rise. The hall and department wise data obtained from the Electric Office unveils that the consumption has increased drastically in almost every hall and department.
Many a times we are seen to leave the lights and fans running while we go to the class; not because of our unwillingness but because of our carelessness. We should always remember that there are still 19,706 villages in our India (Data as of 2015, Census Board, Ministry of Home Affairs, Govt. of India) which remain un-electrified even after 69 years of our independence. Vivekanand Kendra IIT Kharagpur Branch is organizing a lecture on topic "Lessons of Crisis Management from Ramayana" to be delivered by Shri. Hanumanth Rao (All India Treasurer, Vivekananda Kendra, Kanyakumari) on 7th September 2016 at 6.00 pm in V1 Hall Vikramshila Complex, IIT Kharagpur.

OPEN IIT ENGLISH ELOCUTION
The event was organised from 7 pm to 9.30 pm in F-116. Around 40 participants took part in this competition with great zeal and enthusiasm. Students spoke on various topics ranging from racism to environment. Some poems were also recited. In this battle of articulating the ideas with better clarity, expressions and pronunciation, the winners were:

Gold: Abhinav Kumar 15GG20002 Nehru Hall (Requesting a mother to have happiness)
Silver: Abhigna Revuru 14PH20029 SN Hall (Role of communication in relationships)
Bronze: Krutarth Shah 16IE10014 Azad Hall (Conversation between father and son)

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winners!

OPEN IIT PRODUCT DESIGN COMPETITION
The competition saw a cut throat competition where teams fought neck to neck for a podium finish. The competition was organised in the evening of 6th September. A lot of innovative and brainstorming products were pitched and finally, the winners were:

Gold: Team Innovators (Azad Hall)
Silver: Team Prodetors (Prodex)
Bronze: Team Smart LED (RK Hall)

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winners!

OPEN IIT CASE STUDY COMPETITION

The Problem Statement involved the How,Whats and Whys of the Commercially Oriented Academic Institutions.After an amazing competition, it were the teams from Azad Hall of Residence that stole the show. Team Innovation from MT Hall of Residence despite performing exceptionally well could not make it to top three owing to the penalty on time limit.

The standings are:
First Position was bagged by:
Team Azad One & Team Azad Two with 80 points each

Second Position was bagged by:
Team Infinity from RP Hall with 79 points.

Awaaz,IIT Kharagpur heartily congratulates the winning teams.

Here are the pictures of winning teams of Azad and RP respectively.

message: A Teacher is not merely a person imparting objective knowledge; a Teacher is one who teaches the way of life, one whose each conduct is conductible. A Teacher, AND ONLY A TEACHER, can affect a student miles away - Swami Vivekananda
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur updated their cover photo.

message:
RK Hall successfully conducted the cultural event on the eve of teacher's day. The event witnessed a huge audience and a various number of participants for dramatics, elocution, dance, vocals.

However, it was a whole lot of disappointment for the boarders of RK Hall and the hall council members as well. More than 100 of the boarders were involved in the week-long preparation of the activities and almost the whole hall was involved in its conduction.
More than 1000 people from administration and faculty side were invited but only 5-10 people were present, which was very disappointing for the students. While the students did put their heart and soul, they were quite disheartened by the response from the other side. Apart from this, after the movie show for the faculties at Netaji auditorium, students announced about the event and requested professors to stay, still out of total 60 only one of the professors stayed for the cultural evening.
Many times we come to hear things from the teachers' side that the culture is diminishing and the teacher-student relation is degrading but the thing is every time the student side cannot be blamed.

message:
Despite heavy rains, a good number of enthusiastic freshers turned up for the treasure hunt event organised by Azad Hall of Residence yesterday. There were many happy and curious faces ready for the adventurous event. The theme of the event was based on Pokemon. Photos show the excitement and enthusiasm among the freshers. Even Lord Indra was not able to beat the tempo of freshers.
Interestingly it's not the first time that it has rained on the day of an event. It has become quite a ritual of raining on days of special events in Kgp.
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 3 new photos.

message:
What KGP lacks in the absence of high rises, it compensates in the sheer amount of self-motivated student groups or "societies" as we call them, that cater to almost all kind of students: creative, intellectual, managerial or welfare inclined.

You just have to name it and you'll have a group of people actively pursuing it. But the question remains, how do we know what exists? Or, how many groups are present here in our campus?

This is a question that might haunt one's brain as soon as they enter the campus, but it soon fades into oblivion and one might miss the chance to get into a society that aligns with their interests.

We finally decided to compile a one-stop list of all the campus societies that we know of till date.

Presenting to you in an interactive format that might just make you forgive Mendeleev a bit.

The Periodic Table of KGPian Societies, everybody!

https://thescholarsavenue...

P.S: Any societies that need any edits in their respective sections can ping us, or mail us (thescholarsavenue@ gmail.com ) with the edits.
We have only accounted groups that are open to all and are not limited by the Departments and we agree that we might have missed a few nevertheless.
Also, this link is not mobile-friendly yet.

Be there!

Note: Please bring a pendrive along with your laptop, and ensure there is enough charge for the installation to complete smoothly.

message:
Good Morning Folks!
We hope all your days are running well. The saga of waking up just 5 minutes before class is an everlasting one with consequences that might lead to cycle collisions thanks to some of the new changes in rules around here. But for what it's worth, the IIT tag looms large before you and you might as well put these things at the back of your mind.
But there are some things we do look forward to. Scaling the peak of the most coveted institute in the world, the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, is everybody's dream. Getting admission into MIT is an objectively quantified pinnacle of achievement.

Well, that explains the rat race we were put into from a very young age, right? It means that we, with our degrees and achievements, are the ones who are capable of following this road.
Or does it?

Here is a story that will shatter such narrow conceptions and hopefully rekindle the fire for 'learning' within you. The most important thing in one's life is to question everything and set upon a journey to find the answers. The present system of education is stuck in a deep quagmire of controversy, but in the end it is the passion and interest of a person that will actually propel him/her forward.

Read about the inspiring story here: http://www.hindustantimes...

Ready, aim and fire! Here we invite all of you to gather and build the future bit by bit. Come aboard on this exhilarating journey of SRM Hackathon which offers the themes of military, women safety, healthcare, tourism, journalism and e-commerce to develop and furnish your masterpiece. So, hurry and submit your ideas on srmhackathon.hackerearth.... on or before 20th September, 2016

The IIT Council has started working towards its aims of improving the global status of IITs as a research hub.
The Plans include: "to fill 20 per cent vacancies with foreign faculty, allow off-campus PhD students, 20% international students at undergraduate and postgraduate level, a 1:7 faculty-student ratio and separate capital grants for world class infrastructure."

message:
Moving forward with our aim to curate information important to KGPians, we have started to collect "How To"s on metakgp. From guides about Institute formalities, like getting bonafide certificates and transcripts, to how-to's about travel and visas, our list goes on. The best thing is, metakgp is a wiki, this means **anyone** can edit it. So please add your own How To's to make things better.

https://wiki.metakgp.org/...

We having a hackday tomorrow. In a hackday we come together and hack on something. **Absolutely everyone is invited**, it doesn't matter which year you are in, it doesn't matter whether you have been involved with metakgp or not and it doesn't matter if you know much programming or not. We believe everyone will have something to contribute and everyone will be able to learn something from the hackday. You can come with your own ideas or work with someone with the ideas listed below. The ideas need not be related to metaKGP or coding, for that matter.

Venue: Group Study Room, 2nd Floor Annex Building Central Library

Time: 1 PM to 8 PM

https://wiki.metakgp.org/...

We believe everyone will have something to contribute and everyone will be able to learn something from the hackday. You can come with your own ideas or work with someone with the ideas listed below. The ideas need not be related to metakgp or coding for that matter.

Venue: Group Study Room, 2nd Floor Annex Building Central Library

Time: 1 PM to 8 PM

https://wiki.metakgp.org/...

Please message us if you have any questions. See you there :)

The Metakgp Book Club is meeting today at 6:30 PM, Wednesday in the Discussion room, Annex Building, Central Library. You can hear people speak about a book they've read in recent past and later discuss it with the group. And of course, you're also invited to speak.

Check out https://wiki.metakgp.org/...

Can't keep your mind off electrical stuff? This is your chance to unveil your electrifying side to others and exhibit that you have enough potential to make a difference! Participate in Circuitrix Junior and win BONUS MARKS for taking admission in IIIT-Delhi, along with amazing prizes.

Registration is now LIVE!

To register, fill in this form: bit.ly/circuitrixjr-esya1...

Note: This competition is only open for students currently in classes XI and XII.

Still confused about which Elective to take? Check the previous year grade distribution of your course on metakgp. Just Search for your course number or page. Unfortunately we don't have every page, but perfect is the enemy of good.

https://wiki.metakgp.org/...

Technology, IIT Kharagpur shared Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur's post.

SRISTI celebrates the creativity and innovation of young technological students by recognising their outstanding projects with Gandhian Young Technological Innovation (GYTI) Awards. These awards are given every year during the Festival of Innovation (FOIN) at Rashtrapati Bhawan in the month of March. Next year, these awards are due tentatively on March 5, 2017 at FOIN. It is hoped that such recognition will enthuse young innovators to pursue even more outstanding research addressing unmet social needs and set up entrepreneurial ventures in consonance with Start-Up movement gaining strength currently in India.
Any student project that has been completed during 2014-15 to 2016-17 is eligible for consideration of awards.The students need to submit the projects at following URL: www.gyti.techpedia.in.

Financial support is also given to some of the awardees as per numerous windows of opportunity:

Last date for submission of entries is November 30, 2016

You can email your queries to gyti.techpedia@sristi.org ,or call at 9099258492.

Technology Students' Gymkhana congratulates the awards recipients!

Featured today: Encore! Some of its alumni have turned into KGP legends over the years :)

"ENCORE selection auditions are held once per year, only for first years, in August for an active membership for all four/five years. The society selects a batch of 30-40 first years (UG) and 5-10 (PG) at the beginning of the academic year soon after the welcome production. Selection procedure consists of tasks that judge voice modulation, intensity, speech and diction, confidence and acting skills.

In rare cases, exceptional and highly enthusiastic people are also inducted into ENCORE who share a similar passion of theater and contribute to the society. Past members who were inducted include Kaustabh Khare."

https://wiki.metakgp.org/...

Gymkhana awards 2015 - 2016

Application for the gymkhana awards in the genre of technology are invited for

1) Prof. G S Sanyal Cup.
2) Order of merit.
3) Hon'ble mention.
4) Ashoke Mukherjee Cup (Outgoing student who has made outstanding voluntary contribution to the Gymkhana)

CVs should be mailed to gymkhana.kharagpur@ gmail.com by 11/04/2016 at 6pm. All the relevant documents (supporting points mentioned in the CV) should be mailed along with the CV.

In the resumes following information can be included:

*Participation in the GC.
*Position of responsibilities.
*Participation in tech events (eg. KTJ, out station participation).
*Inter IIT Tech achievements.
*Meaningful projects and technical papers.
*National/International conferences.

Regards

Interactive session with Prof. John Mather witnessed an overwhelming response from students and faculty members alike.

We are sincerely thankful to Prof. Somesh Kumar to make the event successful.
story: Technology, IIT Kharagpur added 6 new photos — with Vedasheersh Boorla and Somesh Kumar.

message:
A senior astrophysicist at NASA, Prof. Mather is the recipient of 2006 Nobel prize in Physics. He is a senior project scientist at JSWT, which will be successor to Hubble Space Telescope. He was part of the COBE satellite, which confirmed the Big Bang theory. He was listed twice by TIME magazine; among 100 most influential people in the world in 2007 and then again in 2012 among 25 most influential people in space.

Strengthen the foundation of your thoughts through his precious words.

Date: 29th February (Monday), 6:30 PM
Venue: CET Studio 1, First Floor, Takshashila

A PAN IIT interactive session with Prof. Herald Haas has been arranged on 14th February at 6:30PM. Prof. Haas holds the Chair of Mobile Communications at the University of Edinburgh. He is acclaimed to be the inventor of Light Fidelity (Li-Fi) which was listed among the 50 best inventions in TIME Magazine 2011.

Link for webcast is http://nknvcreplay.nic.in...

Link will be live from Sunday (14th Feb.) 6:30 PM onward. Venue for online interaction is NKN Virtual Classroom, JCB Lab Complex.

Note: The event will consist of a keynote speech from 6:30 PM - 8:00 PM. Q&A session will be from 8:15 PM.

IIT Kharagpur has won the 4th Inter IIT Tech General Championship winning the General Championship for a continuous 2nd time in a row.

2nd. IIT Mandi
3rd. IIT Madras
